The advantage Hamcrest's matcher factory function=
s is that the assertThat method is seamlessly extensible by the user.  I ca=
n write assertThat(someString, isMyMothersMaidenName()), for example, and i=
t looks no different, stylistically, to assertThat(someString, containsStri=
ng("foo")).  The user can write one small component -- the new matcher -- a=
nd seamlessly plug it into anything that accepts a matcher and get all the =
testing and diagnostic descriptions almost for free.

David's suggestion is=
 convenient but cannot be extended. I can't write assertThat(someString).is=
MyMothersMaidenName(), for example. I'd like to see some middle-ground betw=
een the two.  Maybe a factory function can use reflection to create a match=
er that is then passed as a parameter to assertThat.  I think this is how t=
he logicalpractice-collections library works.

--Nat
